pages.name: B1
pages.title: Usage of Google “My Activity” and Google services

elements.name: A3_T1
elements.html:
In the following section, we will ask you some general questions to learn more about your usage of the Google “My Activity” dashboard, as well as how you interact with Google services that contribute to your stored activity. We will also ask a few questions regarding your cross-device Google usage patterns.

A Google activity log refers to the information collected by Google based on your interactions with its products and services. This may include your searches, websites visited, apps used, videos watched, voice and audio interactions, location history, and other related activities. These activity logs are stored in your Google “My Activity” dashboard and may differ across devices and products. (See the figure below)

Below is some brief information to help you understand where activity logs come from and how they are stored:

  • Google stores activity when you use services such as Search, YouTube, Maps, Chrome, and others while signed into your Google Account.
  • Activity may also be stored from multiple devices simultaneously if the same Google Account is signed in.
  • You can view, delete, or manage these activities by visiting https://myactivity.google.com.
  • Activity logs may include timestamps, device details, product information, and, in some cases, content associated with your activity.

elements.name: A3_Q1
elements.title: Approximately how long ago did you create the primary Google Account that you currently use most often?

elements.name: A3_T2
elements.html: Before answering the next set of questions, please visit your Google “My Activity” dashboard (https://myactivity.google.com) and complete the short tasks below. This will help you recall what kind of information is stored in your account.

elements.name: A3_T3
elements.html:
Task Set 1: Visit and Explore Your Activity Dashboard

  1. Scroll through at least 20–25 activity entries from the most recent day.
  2. Observe the types of data stored (e.g., Search, YouTube, Maps, Ads, Android, Assistant, etc.).

elements.name: A3_Q2
elements.title: Verification Question: Please write the name of any one category of activity you saw the most (e.g., Search, YouTube, Maps).

elements.name: A3_T4
elements.html:
Task Set 2: Check Activity by Category

  1. Click on “Filter by date & product”.
  2. View activity for at least 3 different Google products (e.g., YouTube, Maps).

elements.name: A3_Q3
elements.title: Verification Question: Which 3 Google products did you check? (Select all that apply)

elements.name: A3_T5
elements.html:
Task Set 3: Explore Activity Over Time

  1. Use the date filter to view activity from: Today, Yesterday, and Last 30 days.

elements.name: A3_Q4
elements.title: Verification Question: Were there noticeable differences in the types of activity stored across time periods?
choices: Yes, the types of activity changed

elements.name: A3_transition
elements.html: Now that you have explored your Google “My Activity” dashboard and reviewed the types of data stored across products and time, we will ask you a few questions about your observations and experiences. Your responses should be based on what you just saw during the exploration tasks and your general awareness of how Google stores your activity data.

elements.name: B2_Q1
elements.title: The ‘My Activity’ dashboard helps me make informed decisions.

elements.name: B2_Q2
elements.title: What would make it easier to manage your activity data?

elements.name: C1_Q1
elements.title: Would you like to receive reminders to review sensitive items?

elements.name: C1_Q2
elements.title: How likely are you to delete sensitive items you find?

elements.name: C2_Q1
elements.title: Overall, how useful would a guided dashboard be for you?

elements.name: C2_Q2
elements.title: Anything else you’d like to share about your experience?
